document_data.caption: Huzza
document_data.name: Huzza
document_data.formerhomes: A valley near the [[Troll Mountains (the Vast)|Troll Mountains]], [[The Vast]]<ref group="note" name="Troll Mountains">In his profile in ''[[Pirates of the Fallen Stars]]'', Huzza's home valley is referred to as being "near the [[Earthspur Mountains]] at the end of the [[Dragon Reach]]". This can be narrowed down to being near the [[Troll Mountains (the Vast)|Troll Mountains]], as they constitute the only arm of the Earthspurs to come anywhere close to the Reach.
document_data.mainbody: '''Huzza''' was a [[hill giant]] pirate captain active on the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]] as of [[1359 DR]].
document_data.Description: At {{SI|16|ft|long=yes}} tall, Huzza towered over his [[goblin]] crew. He was completely bald and potbellied, and he dressed in thick, foul-smelling, stain-covered skins.
document_data.Personality: Huzza had a simple mind that was driven by the base desire for food and gold.{{Cite dungeon/63/Huzza's Goblin O'War|30}}
document_data.Abilities: With his powerful throwing arm, he could hurl both boulders and goblins up to {{SI|200|yard|long=yes}} away.
document_data.Possessions:
Huzza was captain of a "[[Huzza's goblin o' war|goblin o' war]]", a [[longship]] crewed primarily by goblins. Over his years of raiding, the ship's treasure room accumulated thousands of [[gold]] and [[silver]] [[currency|coins]], as well as a number of [[gem]]s, pieces of [[jewelry]], and [[artwork]]s. Huzza also kept three confiscated [[magic item]]s belonging to the captured [[wizard]] [[Talerus]] in this trove, lest they be used against him.{{Cite dungeon/63/Huzza's Goblin O'War|32-33}}

On his person, Huzza wore a ''[[ring of protection]]'' that could change in size to fit its wearer.{{Cite dungeon/63/Huzza's Goblin O'War|33}} During raids, he wielded a giant log [[shield]] and a spiked [[club]], and in lieu of a regular [[grappling hook]] he used an [[anchor]] tied to a [[hawser]].
document_data.Activities:
Huzza raided other ships by having his ship move in close enough that he could toss his goblin crew members into the riggings in order to cut them, slowing his target down significantly and opening it up to boarding action. In this process, a number of goblins would break their necks on the target ship's hull or miss their target entirely and drown in the sea.

With the addition of a pair of [[margoyle]]s to the crew, Huzza changed up his strategy, having them safely carry the goblins aboard target ships instead.
document_data.Relationships: Although Huzza's goblin crew grew increasingly unhappy with his disregard for their lives, they felt unable to mutiny or desert for fear of simply being eaten. When goblin tossing was phased out in favor of a pair of margoyle carriers, morale among the crew saw significant improvement.
document_data.History:
Prior to his life of piracy, Huzza lived in a valley near the [[Troll Mountains (the Vast)|Troll Mountains]] not far from the [[Dragon Reach]] coast, where he lorded over a local tribe of goblins who guarded his home and provided him with food.<ref group="note" name="Troll Mountains" />

When a band of [[human]] sailors aboard a longship made shore near Huzza's valley, the hill giant was alerted to their presence by his goblin underlings. As he approached to investigate, the seafarers panicked and started attacking Huzza, who eventually overpowered and devoured the entire crew. After a cursory investigation of the ship, Huzza found that the ship was large enough to accommodate himself, provided he could find crewmembers small enough to operate the [[oar]]s and [[sail]].

After sleeping on it for a night, Huzza returned to the longship for further investigation. He thought of the idea of using his valley's goblin tribe, and upon discovering a trove of gold in the back of the ship, he was set on taking to the seas in search of further treasure.

Huzza and his crew would spend the next several years raiding other ships across the Sea of Fallen Stars. Over time, more and more goblins were lost to their captain's tactic of goblin tossing, only to be replenished by pressing other goblin tribes into service.

At some point in his career, during a fresh water run on an island, Huzza discovered an underground lair host to a family of six margoyles. As he stole the hatchlings away to the futile protestations of their parents, he came up with a plan to coerce the elder margoyles into becoming a part of his crew in exchange for the return of two of their four children. With the help of his crew's goblin [[shaman]], who wore a ''[[helm of comprehending languages and reading magic]]'', he relayed these demands, which the margoyles grudgingly accepted.{{Cite dungeon/63/Huzza's Goblin O'War|30-31}}

Within the following couple of months, Huzza's crew saw another addition in the wizard Talerus. With the help of the goblin shaman as interpreter and advocate, Talerus successfully pled for his life, offering the hill giant captain magical services in exchange.
